Alan borrows $5,000 at 14% interest, compounded twice a year. How much does she owe at the end of 6 years?
Jake invested his whole life savings today in an investment that pays 6% interest, compounded annually. In ten years, the investment will be worth $35,817. What is Jake's life savings today?
Rate these 10-year investments from best to worst:

parts.label: b
parts.text: Receive 7.7% interest, compounded 4 times a year for 10 years

parts.label: c
parts.text: Receive 8% interest, compounded twice a year for 10 years

parts.label: d
parts.text: Receive 11% simple interest for the first 5 years, then receive 7% interest, compounded annually, for the next 5 years. (The latter interest is paid on the whole value of the investment after the first 5 years.)

content.text: Geri invests all of her money at the beginning of 2001. At the end of each year, she checks the value of her investment. At the end of what year will she first find she's doubled her money in each of the following cases:

parts.label: a
parts.text: Geri invests all of her money at 5% simple interest

parts.label: b
parts.text: Geri invests all of her money at 5% interest, compounded annually

parts.label: c
parts.text: Geri invests all of her money at 5% interest, compounded twice a year

parts.label: d
parts.text: Geri invests all of her money at 5% interest, compounded monthly

content.text: I have just won a lottery that will pay me $1,100,000 in 10 years. A company offers to buy my lottery ticket today for $650,000.

parts.label: a
parts.text: If the annually compounded interest rate is 9%, should I take the offer?

parts.label: b
parts.text: For what annually compounded interest rate is my lottery ticket worth $300,000 today?

content.text: Suppose the annually compounded interest rate is 8%. Order the following from most valuable to least valuable:

Claire has borrowed $5,000. She will make one payment in 3 years, then another payment in 7. The second payment will be exactly double the amount of the first payment. How much is the first payment if the interest rate of the loan is 8.5%, compounded annually?

For how many positive integers b is log_b(729) a positive integer?
If log_2(log_2(log_2(n))) = 2, then how many digits are in n?
I invested all of my money in an investment that pays the same annually compounded interest rate for 30 years. At the end of the first 10 years, my investment had doubled in value.

parts.label: a
parts.text: After how many years will my original investment have multiplied by 4 in value?

parts.label: b
parts.text: If I initially invested $5,000, how much will my investment be worth at the end of the 30 years?
